yriklaunavan was an elf mage and adventurer and in the midâ€“8 century DR.
He was gruff-voiced, and sounded as gruff as any dwarf, but there was a velvety undertone to his words. He normally looked gloomy, and wore maroon robes when adventuring.
He was rather confident in his spell-dueling skills. Also, he was gruffly sardonic.
At one point, hed gained a castle.
He was part of a group of adventurers together with Nuressa, Folossan, and Amandarn. He later took on an apprentice, Rauntlavon, and became a couple with Nuressa.
On a warm day in Mirtul in the , the group Iyriklaunavan was with ran into a Netherese tomb. In the main room, they spotted a body floating up near the ceiling, and four pillars in a large room. As Iyriklaunavan cast a spell to bring down the corpse, the pillars sprouted hundreds of eyes and attacked them.
After managing to get away from the pillars of eyes, which the corpse attacked and destroyed after animating, the body approached the adventurers and asked what year it was. Nuressa replied with the date, to which the corpse immediately teleported away. The team decided to flee the tomb and leave it unexplored.
Later, it turned out that Amandarn had gambled all their money away shortly afterward Folossan nearly killed him for it. The two stole back some of their coin, got caught, and fled. After spending the evening under an altar to Mystra, they found a small fortune and a deed to a castle by morning, which they presented to the rest of the team. Iyriklaunavan magically verified their account.
During the chaos of the Art in the , Iyriklaunavan had taken on an apprentice, Rauntlavon. They attempted a farscrying together, with Iyrik casting it and Rauntlavon steadying it. However, the spell failed, almost causing damage to the castle room in which they resided. As Nuressa came to him, he revealed that theyd been able to farscry that Azuth had just been magically attacked in the presence of a Chosen of Mystra, and that said Chosen was the body that had escaped back when they were in the Netherese tomb. Iyriklaunavan saw fit to reveal to her theyd been blessed by Mystra, and the process of their acquisition of the castle. More importantly, Rauntlavon noted that the chaos of the Art, if it worsened, would lead to the destruction of their castle, as it had been buttressed with magic itself.
